pullRequest.body:
Also rename `additiveEnergy`/`multiplicativeEnergy` to `addEnergy`/`mulEnergy`.

From LeanAPAP

nodes.body: :v: YaelDillies can now approve this pull request. To approve and merge a pull request, simply reply with `bors r+`. More detailed instructions are available [here](https://bors.tech/documentation/getting-started/#reviewing-pull-requests).
bors merge

Pull request successfully merged into master.

Build succeeded:
  * [Build](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8972624797/job/24641005332)
  * [Check all files imported](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8972624797/job/24641005917)
  * [Lint style](https://github.com/leanprover-community/mathlib4/actions/runs/8972624797/job/24641006341)
bors d+
Mathematically this all looks good, definitions and statements of lemmas are correct and agree with what's used in the literature.
Mathematically this all looks good, definitions and statements of lemmas are correct and agree with what's used in the literature.
bors d+

**[lint-style]** reported by [reviewdog](https://github.com/reviewdog/reviewdog) :dog:
```suggestion simp? ```
False positive. Ignoring.

Could you scope these notations and the next ones? They are a little bit too generic to be always active. Also, maybe write `Finset.multiplicativeEnergy s t` to avoid issues when `Finset` is not open.

> Also, maybe write `Finset.multiplicativeEnergy s t` to avoid issues when `Finset` is not open.

I had to add `Finset.` for scoping, but note that the issue you're thinking of is chiefly a Lean 3 issue. Hygiene means that declaration names in a notation are resolved at the notation's definition, not at parsing.
instead of writing down everywhere the `to_additive` name, could you register in the relevant file that `multiplicativeEnergy` should always be additivized to `additiveEnergy`?

Truth is I want to rename `additiveEnergy`/`multiplicativeEnergy` to `addEnergy`/`mulEnergy`, which is why I didn't want to hardcode the translation.

Since you raised that up, I will perform the rename now.
Could you use the notations you have just introduced, even in preexisting lemmas? I promiss that I will review your PR anyway, so it's not a problem if it makes the file longer.
These should be in the module docstring, and should probably be scoped somehow
Please mention this rename in the PR description.
If these are going to `inherit_doc`, then please mention the notation in the doc for the declarations.

I don't really understand this comment: Now that I've mentioned the notation in the docstring, I can't use `inherit_doc` anymore since it would make the notation hover explain how to get the notation working!

I think that's a good thing? Just because the scope is open doesn't mean the reader knows which scope is the one responsible. If I'm making a new file, the hover on the notation in your file will tell me how to get access to it myself.

Is there precedent for `AddCombi`? Given this is written just once in a file, I'd suggest the longer `AdditiveCombinatorics`, though `mulEnergy` suggests that `PointwiseCombinatorics` might be more apt.
This is the first use. There will probably be more uses, though
In that case I think you should at least spell out `Combinatorics` in full. How about `open scoped Combinatorics.Pointwise`?
`Pointwise` is really misguided here. Additive combinatorics is wider than just the study of sumsets, and sumsets do not only show up in additive combinatorics, even within combinatorics.
In that case, perhaps `open scoped Combinatorics.Additive`?
"Arithmetic combinatorics" is a term that's sometimes used to include both addition and multiplication, but personally I think "Additive combinatorics" is plenty clear

> In that case, perhaps `open scoped Combinatorics.Additive`?

Yes that's what I renamed it to
Can you fix `AddCombi`?

pullRequest.title: [Merged by Bors] - feat: More additive energy lemmas
